item.title: Putin Proposes One More Year of Nuclear Caps With U.S.
item.description: Mr. Putin said Russia didn’t want to provoke a strategic arms race with the United States.

item.title: As U.N. General Assembly Gathers, Here’s What to Watch For
item.description: A look at major figures who will appear during the week and what they might talk about.

item.title: Egypt Pardons Alaa Abd El Fattah, Its Most Prominent Political Prisoner
item.description: Alaa Abd El Fattah, a British-Egyptian dual citizen, was imprisoned for most of the past 12 years as a dissident. He and his mother went on hunger str...

item.title: Foreigners Have Flocked to Copenhagen for Weddings. Is the Honeymoon Over?
item.description: The Danish capital is limiting when foreign couples can marry and setting aside new funding for civil ceremonies.

item.title: High-Tech Greenhouse Brings Fresh Produce to Canada’s Arctic
item.description: A high-tech greenhouse brings fresh produce to Gjoa Haven, an Inuit hamlet in Canada’s Arctic whose residents have little experience growing plants.
